name: market for chipper, stationary, electric | chipper, stationary, electric | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4808/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'chipper, stationary, electric', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This  is a mobile infrastructure, representing the product of an electric wood chipper that it is used at sawmills to produce wood chips from industrial residuals. The product is a stationary machine with a total mass of 2.5 tons that operates with electricity. It has an hourly output of 3.3 m3/h bulked chips and a life time output of 100,000 m3 that corresponds to 18,860,000  kg dried matter of bulked chips. Its production represents all materials necessary to construct it, their end-of-life, energy consumption required for the production and maintenance of the forest machinery.                           

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'chipper, stationary, electric',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'chipper, stationary, electric',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
